author: henokp50
title: Cryptocurrency Exchange for Africa
description: Отсутствие криптовалютной биржи, поддерживающей торговлю на родную фиатную валюту в Эфиопии, Эритрее, Гане, Зимбабве, Джибути, Руанде.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal has a great impact on the Cardano community and has a solution that matches the problem. As a suggestion for improvement, the problem could be better described by bringing facts, examples, or any information that goes beyond the proposer's own statements. That is, back it up with external information. 
The proposal brings a project that is virtually able to be scaled, although it lacks quality in the ability to be audited and executed (these criteria were considered in the other two parts of the assessment and not here).
f6_assessments.q1:
The activities and milestones are detailed enough and the proposer has given access to a demo-view of the exchange. Apparently, the technical skills are fulfilled and this is not an issue. 

However, according to what is presented in the proposal, marketing, networking, crowdfunding, and campaigns are essential to make the proposal feasible. But in the budgeting, in the talent acquisition, or in the relevant experience, no information was given to show that the proposal is fulfilling this big part of the project. Therefore, the proposal is underestimating this aspect of its own.
f6_assessments.q2: By having presented a 4-year proposal, the proposal is not well detailed in a way that the community can make sure it will achieve the milestones. In addition, the milestones and activities in each stage of the platform are putting the expectations too high without backing up the reader or evaluator with information about the market. As a CA, I suggest that the proposer would be more successful if he/she can provide information such as market research, studies indicating the potential growth of an exchange in the mentioned context, or any proof that he/she can achieve at least part of the key steps that will lead the exchange to where is being pointed.

f6_assessments.q0:
Relation to personal qualifications: I have an understanding of budgeting, both due to my past engagement as a treasurer in a political organisation and my current work as a project engineer, which will give me a good grasp of realistic budgeting of projects. The proposal identifies a general problem which needs to be solved; The access to finance and DeFi solutions legitimately is a problem in some countries. 
The proposal describes how it will add value to the Crypto space in African countries, however the relation to Cardano could be defined a bit better. If the exchange is implemented correctly and manages to acquire sufficient liquidity, it will be able to scale to future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer is very transparent about his background and seems competent and up to the task. He provides proof that he already has done some of the neccesary work. It is highly likely that he is up to the challenge. The proposer knows, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal.
The budget is outlined clearly, broken down into identifiable items and seems resonable for the set challenge. No plan however is made for the case that the proposer needs additional funding. The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work and also a time horizon ahead of the typical 12-month milestones.
The proposal provides a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how.
The plan describes the resources necessary to implement the proposal in an identifiable manner.
f6_assessments.q2:
A detailed roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement is presented.
Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal are presented.
The problem and the solution statement are well-defined and reasonable. This proposal overall seems very auditable. Good job.

f6_assessments.q0: Crypto currency to support native fiat currency in specific countries in Africa. A crypto currency exchange and crowdfunding platform that enables users to trade digital assets with a native African currency. This challenge may fit the 'Scale Up Cardano's Community Hubs'.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is a software engineer and blockchain developer, already developed  a production-ready crypto currency trading platform, and can implement the proposal effectively by hiring a few more experts to make a good team. The plan is well detailed mentioning the launch of Ennarea Finance that will provide a cryptocurrency exchange platform that supports trading in native fiat currency; crypto banking and payment processing service for businesses that wants to accept crypto currency payments, among others. All these facts will effectively lead to successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The road map mentions detailed timelines of different tasks: April to June 2022 for product release, July 2022 to Jan 2023 for start up launchpad, etc. The budget is well broken down and very comprehensive for effective auditing. Good proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is well placed in the challenge as it does not fit in any other challenge other than potentially in boosting Cardano's defi. 
If successful The proposal clearly articulates it aims to bring value to the ecosystem by creating an exchange centered in Africa.
f6_assessments.q1: The team lead is referenced and links provided however due to the ambitious nature of the project it would be good to see additional members listed. The prototype is provided and aids in the feasibility of the project and the funds are well broken down. As this is such an ambitious undertaking it would be good to see potential challenges and risks addressed for example legal frameworks within the intended countries and how this may impact the CEX
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap and KPIs are provided and allow for a clear path to audibility however the ambitious goals need sanity checking and smaller measurable metrics to keep the project aligned and that reference the requested funds explicitly.

solution: Криптовалютная биржа, поддерживающая торговлю нативной фиатной валютой для всех африканских стран.
experience: Инженер-программист и разработчик блокчейна разработал готовую к производству криптовалютную торговую платформу.
